name: Hill Valley Schoolhouse
description: A modest wooden schoolhouse, a single room of enforced learning and childish mischief, standing as a testament to the frontier's tentative grasp on civilization. Within these rough-hewn walls, the youth of Hill Valley are subjected to the peculiar ritual of 'cipherin' and readin',' a process designed to prepare them for a future that, statistically speaking, will involve a great deal of hard labor and a surprising lack of dragons. The air smells of chalk dust, old books, and the faint scent of youthful rebellion, a potent cocktail of rudimentary education and unfulfilled potential. It is a place where dreams are both whispered and, more often than not, quietly forgotten.
